column2: Other than those people, the pigs in the farm also liked me. That was because when I fed them, I used three times more bran than others did.

column2: Because of that I fought with the mess chief. I said, at least our pigs should have enough food.

column2: We had a great friendship, ran away, went on denouncement trips together, and now that we met again after twenty years' separation, of course she would open her legs to let me crawl in.

column2: After the "not bad at all," she still said it was no sin.

column1: 因为她像苏格拉底，对一切都一无所知。
column2: Because she was like Socrates, ignorant of everything.

column1: 虽然活了四十多岁，眼前还是奇妙的新世界。
column2: Even though she had lived more than forty years, the world before her eyes still appeared miraculous and new.

column1: 她不知道为什么人家要把她发到云南那个荒凉的地方，也不知为什么又放她回来。 不知道为什么要说她是破鞋，把她押上台去斗争，也不知道为什么又说她不是破鞋，把写好的材料又抽出来。
column2: She didn't know why they dispatched her to a desolate place like Yunnan, nor did she know the reason for letting her return; she didn't know why they accused her of being damaged goods and escorted her to the stage to be denounced, nor could she figure out why they said she was not damaged goods and removed the confessions she had written from her file.

column1: 这些事有过各种解释，但没有一种她能听懂。
column2: There were all kinds of explanations for these things, but she understood none of them.

column1: 她是如此无知，所以她无罪。
column2: She was so ignorant that she had to be innocent.

column2: So it is written in all the law books.

column1: 想明了这一点，一切都能泰然处之。
column2: Once you figure this out, you'll be able to bear everything calmly.

column1: 那时节她穿着棉衣，艰难地爬过院门的门槛。
column2: She had on a cotton coat then, and climbed across the threshold clumsily.

column2: A grain of sand suddenly got into her eye. It was so painful and the cold wind was so cutting that her tears kept rolling down.

column2: She couldn't bear it and wept, as if she were in her little bed trying to cry herself awake.

column2: At that moment her heart, too, was full of extravagant hope.

column2: It dispersed just like the wild mountain wind.

column1: 天是那么蓝，阳光是那么亮，天上还有鸽子在飞。
column2: The sky was so blue, the sunshine so bright, and there were pigeons flying around in the sky.

column1: 此时她想和我交谈，正如那时节她渴望和外面的世界合为一体，溶化到天地中去。

column2: By the time I went back to Beijing, I was in a hurry and didn't have time to fetch the tools. That was how I was reduced to a complete zero.

column1: 我对陈清扬说，我怎么也想不出来在最后一篇交待里她写了什么。
column2: I told Chen Qingyang that I could never figure out what she wrote in her last confession.

column1: 她说，现在不能告诉我。
column2: She said she couldn't tell me right then.

column1: 要告诉我这件事，只能等到了分手的时候。
column2: She wanted to wait until we said goodbye to each other.

column1: 第二天她要回上海，她叫我送她上车站。
column2: She was going back to Shanghai the next day. She asked me to see her off at the train station.

column1: 陈清扬在各个方面都和我不同。
column2: Chen Qingyang was different from me in every respect.

column1: 天亮以后，洗了个冷水澡（没有热水了），她穿戴起来。
column2: After daybreak, she took a cold shower (the hot water had run out), and then began to dress up.

column1: 从内衣到外衣，她都是一个香喷喷的LADY。
column2: From underwear to outfit, she was a perfumed lady.

column1: 而我从内衣到外衣都是一个地道的土流氓。
column2: I, on the other hand, was a genuine local hooligan from underwear to outfit.

column1: 无怪人家把她的交待材料抽了出来，不肯抽出我的。
column2: No wonder people took the confessions out of her file but left mine.

column1: 这就是说，她那破裂的处女膜长了起来。
column2: That is to say, her hymen had grown back.

column1: 而我呢，根本就没长过那个东西。
column2: As for me, I never had that thing anyway.

column1: 除此之外，我还犯了教唆之罪，我们在一起犯了很多错误，既然她不知罪，只好都算在我账上。
column2: Besides that, I also committed the crime of instigation. We had committed many errors together and since she didn't know what her sin was, it had to be counted as mine.

column1: 我们结了账，走到街上去。
column2: We checked out and walked in the street.

column1: 这时我想，她那篇交待材料一定淫秽万分。
column2: Now I began to think that the last confession of hers must be extremely obscene.

column1: 看交待材料的人都心硬如铁，水平无比之高，能叫人家看了受不住，那还好得了？
column2: Those who read our confessions were people with stone hearts and high political consciousness. If they couldn't bear reading it, it had to be pretty bad.

column1: 陈清扬说，那篇材料里什么也没写，只有她真实的罪孽。
column2: Chen Qingyang said, in that confession, she wrote nothing but her true sin.

column1: 陈清扬说她真实的罪孽，是指在清平山上。
column2: Chen Qingyang said that by her true sin she meant the incident on Mount Qingping.

column1: 那时她被架在我的肩上，穿着紧裹住双腿的筒裙，头发低垂下去，直到我的腰际。
column2: She was being carried on my shoulder then, wearing the Thai skirt that bound her legs tightly together, and her hair hung down to my waist.

column1: 天上白云匆匆，深山里只有我们两个人。
column2: The white cloud in the sky hurried on its journey, and there were only two of us in the midst of mountains.

column1: 我刚在她屁股上打了两下，打得非常之重，火烧火撩的感觉正在飘散。
column2: I had just smacked her bottom; I spanked her really hard. The burning feeling was fading.

column1: 打过之后我就不管别的事，继续往山上攀登。
column2: After that I cared about nothing else but continuing to climb the mountain.

column1: 陈清扬说，那一刻她感到浑身无力，就瘫软下来，挂在我肩上。
column2: Chen Qingyang said that moment she felt limp all over, so she let go of herself, hanging over my shoulder.

column1: 那一刻她觉得如春藤绕树，小鸟依人。
column2: That moment she felt like a spring vine entangling a tree, or a young bird clinging to its master.

column1: 她再也不想理会别的事，而且在那一瞬间把一切都遗忘。
column2: She no longer cared about anything else, and at that moment she had forgotten everything.

column1: 在那一瞬间她爱上了我，而且这件事永远不能改变。
column2: At that moment she fell in love with me, and that would never change.

column1: 在车站上陈清扬说，这篇材料交上去，团长拿起来就看。
column2: At the train station, Chen Qingyang told me when she submitted this confession, the regimental commander read it immediately.

column1: 看完了面红耳赤，就像你的小和尚。
column2: And after he finished reading his face was red all over, just like your little Buddha.

column1: 后来见过她这篇交待材料的人，一个个都面红耳赤，好像小和尚。
column2: People who read this confession later all blushed too, like the little Buddha.

column1: 后来人保组的人找了她好几回，让她拿回去重写，但是她说，这是真实情况，一个字都不能改。
column2: Afterward the public security people approached her several times, asking her to rewrite it. But she said, This is what really happened. Not a word should be changed.

column1: 人家只好把这个东西放进了我们的档案袋。
column2: They had no choice but to place it into her file.

column1: 陈清扬说，承认了这个，就等于承认了一切罪孽。
column2: Chen Qingyang said, admitting this amounts to admitting all her sins.

column1: 在人保组里，人家把各种交待材料拿给她看，就是想让她明白，谁也不这么写交待。
column2: When she was in the public security office, they showed her all kinds of confessions, just to let her know what she couldn't write in her confession.

column1: 但是她偏要这么写。
column2: But she insisted on writing in this way.

column1: 她说，她之所以要把这事最后写出来，是因为它比她干过的一切事都坏。
column2: She said that the reason that she wanted to write about it was because it was worse than anything else she had done.

column1: 以前她承认过分开双腿，现在又加上，她做这些事是因为她喜欢。
column2: She admitted before that she opened her legs; now she added that the reason she had done it was because she liked it.

column1: 做过这事和喜欢这事大不一样。
column2: Doing something is very different from liking it.

column1: 前者该当出斗争差，后者就该五马分尸千刀万剐。
column2: The former warranted going on denouncement trips; and the latter warranted being torn apart by five running horses or being minced by thousands of knives.

column1: 但是谁也没权力把我们五马分尸，所以只好把我们放了。
column2: But no one had the power to tear us apart with five horses, so they had no choice but to set us free.

column1: 陈清扬告诉我这件事以后，火车就开走了。
column2: After Chen Qingyang told me this, the train roared away.

column1: 以后我再也没见过她。
column2: From that moment on, I never saw her again.
